Models.py¶

class apps.scorecard.models.Frame(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a bowling frame, which consists of two turns per frame. A scorecard will have between 10 and 12 frames

class apps.scorecard.models.Game(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The game model is essentially the root model of the application, and represents a bowling game

class apps.scorecard.models.IntegerRangeField(verbose_name=None, name=None, min_value=None, max_value=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Custom field type to support max/min integer values

class apps.scorecard.models.ScoreCard(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a score card (i.e.player) with aggregated metrics about a player’s performance in a game

Managers.py¶

class apps.scorecard.managers.FrameManager[source]¶

Provides table-level functionality to the Frame model.

calculate_frames(active_frame)[source]¶

Runs through all frames related to a particular score card, and calculates the score for each frame. :param active_frame: The active frame being bowled :type active_frame: object :returns: queryset - list of Frame objects for a particular scorecard, ordered according to framenumber

create_bonus_frame(request, active_frame, active_card)[source]¶

creates a bonus frame, where frame_num > 10. :param request: the http request object :type requset: object :param active_frame: the current frame being bowled :type active_frame: object :param active_card: the current card being bowled :type active_card: object :returns: object - the newly created bonus frame

frame_count(active_card)[source]¶

Counts number of frames related to a particular scorecard. :param active_card: The active scorecard being bowled :type active_card: object :returns: int - count of frames related to active_card

make_frames(score_card)[source]¶

Auto-creates 10 frame objects related to a given ScoreCard :param score_card: The Score Card each new frame will relate to :type score_card: object :returns: True

next_player_and_frame(request, player_count, active_card)[source]¶

This function determines which scorecard and frame objects are the next to be active. Save these values to the session. :param request: the htt prequest object :request type: http request object :player_count: the number of players (scorecards) in the game :type player_count: int :param active_card: the active scorecard being bowled :type active_card: object :returns: object – returns the session object

class apps.scorecard.managers.GameManager[source]¶

Provides table-level functionality to the Game model.

active()[source]¶

Returns the current (active) game being played. This is kind of a cheap trick because the active game is determined by the most recently created game in the database, which leverages the built-in last() manager function. In the future, a better implementation is to tie a game to a particular user and cache that game and a unique ID in the session.

class apps.scorecard.managers.ScoreCardManager[source]¶

Provides table-level functionality to the ScoreCard model.

calc_rankings(game)[source]¶

Calculates each player’s ranking and updates players’ scorecards accordingly :param game: The game we want information about :type game: object :returns: bool – True if the function executed completely

player_count(game)[source]¶

Returns number of players in the game. :param game: The game we want information about :type game: object :returns: int – the number of players in the game

player_ranking(game)[source]¶

Returns a queryset of the game’s players in order of their total scores and player name :param: The game we want information about :type game: object :returns: queryset - A list of ScoreCard objects in order of their total scores

players(game)[source]¶

Returns the sorecards of all the players in the active game. :param game: The game we want the scorecards from :type game: object :returns: queryset – a list of ScoreCard objects

Decorators.py¶

apps.scorecard.decorators.flush_session(_view)[source]¶

Ensures session is wiped out before entering a particular view.

:param _view:the view function to be wrapped :type _view: function :returns: wrapper function

apps.scorecard.decorators.session_required(_view)[source]¶

Ensures that the proper session data exists. If if doesn’t, this decorator will create the initial session data required for the game.

Parameters:_view – the view function to be wrapped
Returns:wrapper function
